lines.gurmukhi: locn iblok rUp rMg AMg AMg Cib shj ibnod mod kauqk idKwvhI
lines.transliteration_english: Lochan Bilok Roop Rang Ang Ang Chhabi , Sahaj Binod Mod Kaoutak Dikhaavahee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The eyes of a Sikh of the Guru are seeing the adornment of the every limb, colour and form of the True Guru. The bliss of the spiritual knowledge and its wondrous effect is evident.

lines.gurmukhi: sÍn sujs rs risk rswl gun sun sun suriq sMdys phucwvhI
lines.transliteration_english: Sravan Sujas Ras Rasik Rasaal Gouna , Soun Soun Surati Sandays Pahouchaavahee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The ears of a Gursikh have become relishers of the virtues of the True Guru having heard them perpetually, and they are reaching the messages of His wondrous deeds to his consciousness.

lines.gurmukhi: rsnw sbdu rwg nwd sÍwdu ibnqI kY nwskw sugMiD snbMD smJwvhI
lines.transliteration_english: Rasanaa Sabadu Raag Naad Svaadu Binatee Kai , Naasakaa Sougandhi Sanabandh Samajhaavahee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The tongue of a Gursikh is uttering the words blessed by the True Guru. Its music is sounding in the tenth door and the pleasure so generated is reaching his consciousness in the form of prayer and the fragrance of Naam Simran is also being conveyed by th

lines.gurmukhi: sirqw Anyk mwno sMgm smuMdR giq irdY piRX pRym nymu qiRpiq n pwvhI ]620]
lines.transliteration_english: Saritaa Anayk Maano Sangam Samoundr Gati , Ridai Priy Praym Naymu Tripati N Paavahee ?620?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as many rivers fall in the sea and yet its thirst is never satiated. So is the love of his dear beloved in the heart of Gursikh where multi-waves of Naam are propagating yet its loving thirst is never satiated.  (620)
